Deficiency Narrative: Staff members engaged in a verbal altercation in the presence of children in care.
Correction Narrative:
A conversation with the owner held on 06/17/2025 indicated she spoke with both staff and provided the option of one going to work at the other facility and also directly reporting to her as supervisor.

On 08/18/2025 an email received from Administrator with a letter stating the staff involved in the verbal altercation is no longer employed at the operation and her last day was July 16, 2025.  
 
Staff no longer employed at the operation was verified as inactive in CLASS.

Deficiency Narrative: During an investigation it was discovered that a resident in care was absent from the facility without the knowledge of staff for over an hour.
Correction Narrative: 748.685(a)(4) Caregiver responsibility -Blessed Kidz staff has been retrained by the Administrator on providing the level of supervision necessary to ensure each child's safety and well-being

Deficiency Narrative: During an investigation medical records requested, had incomplete logs of the residents refusing or taking medicine.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided completed log that indicates resident taking medication or refusing to take medication and it was signed and dated by caregiver who administered the medication.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee, who is no longer employed at the operation, as of 11/23/2024, still have an active background check.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the updated response on December 4, 2024:
Blessed Kidz will ensure that each employee is deactivated in the system upon termination or their exit from employment. The administrator will inactivate each employee that is no longer associated with the operation within 7 days of them leaving

The operation provided the following response on December 3, 2024:
Blessed Kidz will ensure that each employee is deactivated in the system upon termination or their exit from employment.

Deficiency Narrative: Expired medication dated 11/24/2024 was still in the medication bin on 12/03/2024.
Correction Narrative:
Operation provided the discontinued medication log on 12/16/2024.  Supervisor approval was received to not conduct a follow-up.

The operation provided the following updated response on 12/04/2024:

Blessed Kidz will ensure that all expired meds will be inventoried and stored separately from current meds by logging the dates of expiration and discarding appropriately. The administrator will ensure that the medication that is taken by the residents are still valid and will properly discard any expired medication.

The operation provided the following response on December 3, 2024:

Blessed Kidz will ensure that all expired meds will be inventoried and stored separately from current meds by logging the dates of expiration and discarding appropriately.

After the inspection ended, the Inspector observed the Administrator inventorying and discarding the expired over-the-counter medication.

Deficiency Narrative: Cleaning supplies were observed unlocked and accessible to children.
Correction Narrative:
Inspector conducted a physical walkthrough of the operation, and all chemicals and/or poisonous items were observed to be locked, stored appropriately, and inaccessible to children in care. 

The operation provided the following response on November 13, 2024:

Blessed Kidz RTC will ensure poisonous/flammable material is stored in an area that is inaccessible to children unless child is capable to use responsibly by training staff to make sure it is locked away in a closet with the other chemicals.

Deficiency Narrative: Two medication logs were observed to be blank for the reason for the prescribed medication.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following response on November 26:

Blessed Kidz RTC will ensure that the reason medication was prescribed is clearly indicated on the medication log by checking each one individually.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident report is documented as N/A where the information should include information for each child involved in the incident.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following response on November 26, 2024:
Blessed Kidz RTC has provided additional training and a template to ensure the Serious Incident Documentation includes the name, age, gender, date of admission and any other required information for all children involved in an incident.

Deficiency Narrative: Nearly all documents provided were observed to be incomplete and/or partially provided and an incident report was unable to be located.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following response on November 26, 2024:
Blessed Kidz RTC has provided training and templates to all staff to ensure that the records are current, complete, true and accurate as reflected in its operational responsibilities.

Deficiency Narrative: Seven of seven medication log do not include the name and signature of the staff member who administered the medication.  Only one medication log has a staff name, signature, and initial but the initial doesn't belong to any of the staff initials on the dates the medications were administered.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following response on November 26, 2024:
Blessed Kidz RTC has provided training on including the name and signature of the person administering the medication.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member put children at risk of harm by allowing the children to intervene when attempting to de-escalate an incident and in an emergency situation.
Correction Narrative:
Inspector conducted an inspection at the operation, and the operation continues to provide training to caregivers and ensuring that only staff members perform caregiver duties and redirect children as needed. Inspector monitored the behaviors and interactions of the children and staff. Inspector didn't observe staff members to allow children to perform caregiver duties during the inspection, and none of the children were observed attempting to perform caregiver duties. 

The operation provided the following response on November 26, 2024:

Blessed Kidz RTC will provide additional training to ensure the caregiver will provide a safe environment for all children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection in  bedroom 3 it was observed that there were no blinds or curtains.
Correction Narrative: During the follow-up inspection, the inspector observed all windows to include curtains, blinds, or shades and there was no concern noted for privacy in the children's bedrooms.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was observed that the emergency evacuation diagram postings do not have anything to indicate where the children and staff should shelter in place during threatening weather.
Correction Narrative: Inspector conducted a physical inspection at the operation, and operation had the correct emergency evacuation route that was approved during the standard by standard, and it includes the shelter in place which is indicated by a black dot with a legend to include this information.  Emergency evacuation route was observed to be posted in all required areas.

Deficiency Narrative: The annual summary log was observed to be missing all of the required criteria and only outlined the child's name, date of abscense, return date & hotline report confirmation number.
Correction Narrative: On October 22, 2024, a physical inspection was conducted at the operation.  During the inspection, the operation provided a copy of the unauthorized absence log, that was approved, during the standard by standard.  The unauthorized absence summary log has all of the required components per ยง748.453.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was observed that  in bedroom three, the window was broken. In place of the glass there is a plexy glass glued to the barrier of the window pane, and is not completely glued on.
Correction Narrative: During the on-site inspection, inspector observed a repaired window in bedroom three.  There wasn't evidence of broken glass nor hazards.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was not administered a suicide risk screening on the date of admission.
Correction Narrative:
The operation provided the following compliance response:

Solution to Comply with Standard: In order to comply with this standard moving forward, the facility has made the ASQ a part of the intake process by adding it to the admissions checklist. This will ensure that the ASQ is not overlooked and is completed at time of intake.
